SVGFEImageElement.summary: The SVGFEImageElement interface corresponds to the feImage element.

SVGFEImageElementWidth.summary: The width read-only property of the interface describes the horizontal size of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the {{SVGAttr("width")}} attribute of the feImage element, which fetches image data from an external source and provides the pixel data as output. The attribute is a <length> or a <percentage> relative to the width of the filter region. The default value is 100%. The property value is a length in user coordinate system units.

-
-SVG tutorial: Filter effects
-SVG Filter primitive attributes
-CSS blend-mode data type
-CSS mix-blend-mode property

SVGFEImageElementX.summary: The x read-only property of the interface describes the horizontal coordinate of the position of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the {{SVGAttr("x")}} attribute of the feImage element, which fetches image data from an external source and provides the pixel data as output. The attribute is a <length> or <percentage>. The <coordinate> is a length in the user coordinate system that is the given distance from the origin of the user coordinate system along the x-axis. If the x attribute is a percent value, the property value is relative to the width of the filter region in user coordinate system units. The default value is 0.

-
-SVG tutorial: Filter effects
-SVG Filter primitive attributes
-CSS blend-mode data type
-CSS mix-blend-mode property

SVGFEImageElementHref.summary: The href read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("href")}} or {{SVGAttr("xlink:href")}} {{deprecated_inline}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feImage")}} element.

SVGFEImageElementHeight.summary: The height read-only property of the interface describes the vertical size of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the {{SVGAttr("height")}} attribute of the feImage element, which fetches image data from an external source and provides the pixel data as output. The attribute is a <length> or a <percentage> relative to the height of the filter region. The default value is 100%. The property value is a length in user coordinate system units.

-
-SVG tutorial: Filter effects
-SVG Filter primitive attributes
-CSS blend-mode data type
-CSS mix-blend-mode property

SVGFEImageElementResult.summary: The result read-only property of the interface describes the assigned name of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the {{SVGAttr("result")}} attribute of the {{SVGElement("feImage")}} element, which fetches image data from an external source and provides the pixel data as output. The attribute value is a custom-ident. If supplied, then graphics that result from processing this filter primitive can be referenced by an {{SVGAttr("in")}} attribute on a subsequent filter primitive within the same {{SVGElement("filter")}} element.

If no result attribute is defined, the filter's result.baseVal and result.animVal are empty strings, and the output of the <feImage> filter will only be available for re-use as the implicit input into the next filter primitive if that filter primitive provides no value for its in attribute.

-custom-ident data type
-SVG tutorial: Filter effects
-SVG Filter primitive attributes
-CSS blend-mode data type
-CSS mix-blend-mode property

SVGFEImageElementPreserveAspectRatio.summary: The preserveAspectRatio read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("preserveAspectRatio")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feImage")}} element.

SVGFEImageElementY.summary: The y read-only property of the interface describes the vertical coordinate of the position of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the {{SVGAttr("y")}} attribute of the feImage element, which fetches image data from an external source and provides the pixel data as output. The attribute is a <length> or <percentage>. The <coordinate> is a length in the user coordinate system that is the given distance from the origin of the filter along the y-axis. If the y attribute is a percent value, the property value is a relative to the height of the filter region in user coordinate system units. The default value is 0.
